class_notes:
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement: - Theme.
Our seminar will explore a single, though not a simple, question:  
What is human goodness?  What sorts of lives are good lives?  How does goodness relate to flourishing?  
Our approach will be broadly philosophical. We will read and discuss together a range of texts as we pursue our questions about goodness, ethics, and forms of life.  Some texts will be philosophical and theological, some biographical, some literary, some filmic.   
This is a discussion class: we are in this together, and we learn from one another as well as from our readings.  Your attendance and participation are essential to the success of this course.
course_description: Analysis of methods and/or texts pertaining to ethical decision-making for individual and social problems such as race, sex/marriage, justice, war, biomedical technology, and environmental pollution. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
